e4: Although some investors may initially react negatively to the change, long-term trust and ethical conduct are paramount. The current policy, while seemingly accepted by the market, is fundamentally dishonest and exposes the company to legal risk. A transparent approach aligned with ethical accounting practices benefits the company in the long run.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy. It presents a clear, unbiased picture of the company's financial performance, allowing investors to make informed decisions. This means avoiding manipulation or exaggeration of figures, even if it seems advantageous in the short term. Maintaining consistent accounting practices builds trust with stakeholders and upholds the integrity of the market.
e6: Yes, I would have some follow-up questions.  Firstly, what strategies can we implement to communicate the policy change clearly and effectively to all investors? Secondly, what is the management team's assessment of the potential short-term market impact and how do they plan to mitigate any negative reactions?  Finally, what legal counsel has been consulted regarding this matter and what steps have been taken to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements?
